content.question: The position of a particle in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane is given by the vector-valued function <math alttext="p open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses negative e to the power of t end exponent plus 5 close parentheses vector i plus open parentheses ln t close parentheses vector j"><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mi>t</mi></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced><mover><mi>i</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mover><mi>j</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> for <math alttext="1 less than t less than 1.5"><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1.5</mn></math>. The vector-valued function <math alttext="v open parentheses t close parentheses equals x open parentheses t close parentheses vector i plus y open parentheses t close parentheses vector j"><mi>v</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mover><mi>i</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mover><mi>j</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> gives the velocity of the particle for <math alttext="1 less than t less than 1.5"><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1.5</mn></math>. Which of the following is true?

choices.label: The particle is always moving to the left and up, so <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses less than 0"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses greater than 0"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

The particle is always moving to the left and up, so <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses greater than 0"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses less than 0"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

The particle is always moving to the right and up, so <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses greater than 0"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses greater than 0"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

The particle is always moving to the right and up, so <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses less than 0"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses greater than 0"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

content.answer: The particle is always moving to the left and up, so <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses less than 0"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses greater than 0"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
